page.title: 02Ardross area - general
page.content: burial chamber. This area is mainly crofting and forestry. The crofting land around Glaick is used to grow crops or grass for cattle. To the south of Ardross is a castle: it has recently been bought by a big firm based in London. They are now renovating and restoring the castle. To the south of the castle is the River Averon. This runs past Ardross and through to Alness where it flows into the Cromarty Firth. It is a clean river frequently used for fishing, but permission must be sought for this. All the land on both sides of the Averon is privately owned. Ardross is a rural farming community with mountains in the distance and green fertile hills surrounding the small farmhouses and buildings.
